text: @ScramPratchett The expression of his face, and speaking through the water-drops; "it's a means for the coterie of the district to feather their nests."

passages.full_quote: <used>The expression of his face</used> would have been grim, and even cruel, if it had not at the same time had a look of suffering which touched her
She remembered his words, the <used>expression of his face, t</used>hat recalled a submissive setter dog, in the early days of their connection

Heavy in figure, movement, and comprehension, -- in the sluggish complexion <used>of his face, and</used> in the large, awkward tongue that seemed to loll about in his mouth as he himself lolled about in a room, -- he was idle, proud, niggardly, reserved, and suspicious

passages.full_quote: said he, sluicing <used>his face, and speaking through the water-drops; "it's no</used>thing, Pip"
said Wemm<used>ick; "it's a</used> good rule never to leave documentary evidence if you can help it, because you don't know when it may be put in"

passages.fragment: `` it 's a means for the coterie of the district to feather their nests
passages.full_quote: "On one side it's a plaything; they play at being a parliament, and I'm neither young enough nor old enough to find amusement in playthings; and on the other side" ( he stammered ) "<used>it's a means for the coterie of the district to feather their nests</used>"
